title: C++ Programming Quiz
description: Test your C++ programming skills with advanced concepts

questions.question: What is the output of cout << sizeof(char) in C++?
questions.explanation: The size of char is always 1 byte in C++, by definition.

questions.question: Which operator is used for dynamic memory allocation in C++?
questions.explanation: The 'new' operator is used for dynamic memory allocation in C++.

questions.question: What is the difference between struct and class in C++?
options: struct members are public by default, class members are private by default
struct is for data, class is for functions
questions.explanation: The only difference is default access: struct members are public by default, class members are private by default.

questions.question: Which header file is needed for input/output operations in C++?
questions.explanation: <iostream> is the standard header for input/output operations in C++.

questions.question: What does the 'virtual' keyword do in C++?
questions.explanation: The 'virtual' keyword enables runtime polymorphism by allowing function overriding in derived classes.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a valid loop in C++?
questions.explanation: C++ has for, while, and do-while loops. 'repeat-until' is not a valid loop construct in C++.

questions.question: What is a destructor in C++?
options: A function that destroys objects and cleans up resources
questions.explanation: A destructor is automatically called when an object goes out of scope to clean up resources.

questions.question: Which access specifier allows access from derived classes but not from outside?
questions.explanation: Protected members are accessible within the class and its derived classes, but not from outside.

questions.question: What is function overloading in C++?
options: Having multiple functions with the same name but different parameters
questions.explanation: Function overloading allows multiple functions with the same name but different parameter lists.

questions.question: Which operator is used to access members of a structure through a pointer?
questions.explanation: The arrow operator (->) is used to access members through a pointer.

questions.question: What is the correct way to declare a constant in C++?
questions.explanation: The 'const' keyword is used to declare constants in C++.

questions.question: Which of these is used for exception handling in C++?
questions.explanation: try-catch blocks are used for exception handling in C++.
